channel.title: Java is garbage

item.title: Java is garbage
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Switch/case statements and writing things out are not inherently evil. If you mess around using character code formulas you’re asking for trouble because you’re duct-taping a solution using a pattern that does not actually fit. As for reflection, the same issue applies - it is an incomplete formula that is limited to the same range as the character code formulas. Parsing the constant name will be of no use for anything non-alphanumeric (not even stating that this is an incredibly hacky abuse of reflection).

Also, note that neither the reflection or character code formula method takes modifiers into account properly, as the code I pasted does.

Just describe the complete set of what you want to be typed.

Read full topic

well, the winapi way doesnt do it as well as that java code aftermath pasted.

item.title: Java is garbage
item.dc:creator: @Repentless Repentless
item.description:
@Repentless wrote:

Aftermath: Your code is exactly what I didn’t want to do. I’m trying to say that something that should be relatively simple (as it is in C) is made overly complicated because there is no way to get the keycode of a character in Java without reflection and other hacky techniques. If there is no way to get keycodes, you have to make a list of keycodes for every character and use a switch statement. Or integer value - 32 black magic, and then you’re still left with switch for non-letter symbols. Any way to do it in Java sucks.

MITB: See above.

Read full topic

item.title: Java is garbage
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

More like ‘programmer is garbage’. Just because you know a way to do something, but refuse to do it that way and can’t figure out another way to do it doesn’t make the language you are working in bad, it just makes you look like an idiot.

Read full topic

item.title: Java is garbage
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Been done before… don’t rewrite code that’s already been written. This does it better than your code:

[code]public class Keyboard {

private Robot robot;

public static void main(String... args) throws Exception {
    Keyboard keyboard = new Keyboard();
    keyboard.type("Hello there, how are you?");
}

public Keyboard() throws AWTException {
    this.robot = new Robot();
}

public Keyboard(Robot robot) {
    this.robot = robot;
}

public void type(CharSequence characters) {
    int length = characters.length();
    for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
            char character = characters.charAt(i);
            type(character);
    }
}

public void type(char character) {
    switch (character) {
    case 'a': doType(VK_A); break;
    case 'b': doType(VK_B); break;
    case 'c': doType(VK_C); break;
    case 'd': doType(VK_D); break;
    case 'e': doType(VK_E); break;
    case 'f': doType(VK_F); break;
    case 'g': doType(VK_G); break;
    case 'h': doType(VK_H); break;
    case 'i': doType(VK_I); break;
    case 'j': doType(VK_J); break;
    case 'k': doType(VK_K); break;
    case 'l': doType(VK_L); break;
    case 'm': doType(VK_M); break;
    case 'n': doType(VK_N); break;
    case 'o': doType(VK_O); break;
    case 'p': doType(VK_P); break;
    case 'q': doType(VK_Q); break;
    case 'r': doType(VK_R); break;
    case 's': doType(VK_S); break;
    case 't': doType(VK_T); break;
    case 'u': doType(VK_U); break;
    case 'v': doType(VK_V); break;
    case 'w': doType(VK_W); break;
    case 'x': doType(VK_X); break;
    case 'y': doType(VK_Y); break;
    case 'z': doType(VK_Z); break;
    case 'A': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_A); break;
    case 'B': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_B); break;
    case 'C': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_C); break;
    case 'D': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_D); break;
    case 'E': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_E); break;
    case 'F': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_F); break;
    case 'G': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_G); break;
    case 'H': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_H); break;
    case 'I': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_I); break;
    case 'J': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_J); break;
    case 'K': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_K); break;
    case 'L': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_L); break;
    case 'M': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_M); break;
    case 'N': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_N); break;
    case 'O': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_O); break;
    case 'P': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_P); break;
    case 'Q': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_Q); break;
    case 'R': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_R); break;
    case 'S': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_S); break;
    case 'T': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_T); break;
    case 'U': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_U); break;
    case 'V': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_V); break;
    case 'W': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_W); break;
    case 'X': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_X); break;
    case 'Y': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_Y); break;
    case 'Z': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_Z); break;
    case '`': doType(VK_BACK_QUOTE); break;
    case '0': doType(VK_0); break;
    case '1': doType(VK_1); break;
    case '2': doType(VK_2); break;
    case '3': doType(VK_3); break;
    case '4': doType(VK_4); break;
    case '5': doType(VK_5); break;
    case '6': doType(VK_6); break;
    case '7': doType(VK_7); break;
    case '8': doType(VK_8); break;
    case '9': doType(VK_9); break;
    case '-': doType(VK_MINUS); break;
    case '=': doType(VK_EQUALS); break;
    case '~': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_BACK_QUOTE); break;
    case '!': doType(VK_EXCLAMATION_MARK); break;
    case '@': doType(VK_AT); break;
    case '#': doType(VK_NUMBER_SIGN); break;
    case '$': doType(VK_DOLLAR); break;
    case '%': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_5); break;
    case '^': doType(VK_CIRCUMFLEX); break;
    case '&': doType(VK_AMPERSAND); break;
    case '*': doType(VK_ASTERISK); break;
    case '(': doType(VK_LEFT_PARENTHESIS); break;
    case ')': doType(VK_RIGHT_PARENTHESIS); break;
    case '_': doType(VK_UNDERSCORE); break;
    case '+': doType(VK_PLUS); break;
    case '\t': doType(VK_TAB); break;
    case '\n': doType(VK_ENTER); break;
    case '[': doType(VK_OPEN_BRACKET); break;
    case ']': doType(VK_CLOSE_BRACKET); break;
    case '\\': doType(VK_BACK_SLASH); break;
    case '{': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_OPEN_BRACKET); break;
    case '}': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_CLOSE_BRACKET); break;
    case '|': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_BACK_SLASH); break;
    case ';': doType(VK_SEMICOLON); break;
    case ':': doType(VK_COLON); break;
    case '\'': doType(VK_QUOTE); break;
    case '"': doType(VK_QUOTEDBL); break;
    case ',': doType(VK_COMMA); break;
    case '<': doType(VK_LESS); break;
    case '.': doType(VK_PERIOD); break;
    case '>': doType(VK_GREATER); break;
    case '/': doType(VK_SLASH); break;
    case '?': doType(VK_SHIFT, VK_SLASH); break;
    case ' ': doType(VK_SPACE); break;
    default:
            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cannot type character " + character);
    }
}

private void doType(int... keyCodes) {
    doType(keyCodes, 0, keyCodes.length);
}

private void doType(int[] keyCodes, int offset, int length) {
    if (length == 0) {
            return;
    }

    robot.keyPress(keyCodes[offset]);
    doType(keyCodes, offset + 1, length - 1);
    robot.keyRelease(keyCodes[offset]);
}

}[/code]

stackoverflow.com

Convert String to KeyEvents

java, awtrobot
asked by Martin Trigaux on 10:21AM - 08 Aug 09

P.S. any reflection hack work-around is a terrible and ugly idea, as is any hack using 65 + whatever.

EDIT: Original code was missing imports, added them for you.

import java.awt.AWTException; import java.awt.Robot; import static java.awt.event.KeyEvent.*;

item.title: Java is garbage
item.dc:creator: @Repentless Repentless
item.description:
@Repentless wrote:

Use java.awt.Robot to type each character in a string… easy right???

Look at all these fucking lines of code and I still haven’t finished it.

import java.awt.AWTException;
import java.awt.Robot;
import java.lang.Character;

public class sendkeys {
	public static void quick(String keys) {
		Robot robot;
		try {
			robot = new Robot();
			for (int character = 0; character < keys.length(); character++) {
				if (Character.isWhitespace(keys.charAt(character))) {
					robot.keyPress(32);
					robot.keyRelease(32);
				} else if (Character.isLowerCase(keys.charAt(character))) {
					int num = keys.charAt(character);
					int keycode = num - 32;
					robot.keyPress(keycode);
					robot.keyRelease(keycode);
				} else if (Character.isUpperCase(keys.charAt(character))) {
					robot.keyPress(16);
					robot.keyPress(keys.charAt(character));
					robot.keyRelease(16);
					robot.keyRelease(keys.charAt(character));
				} else if (!Character.isLetter(keys.charAt(character))) {
					robot.keyPress(getSymbolKeycode(keys.charAt(character)));
					robot.keyRelease(getSymbolKeycode(keys.charAt(character)));
				} else {
					System.out.println("Something unexpected happened.");
				}
				
			}
		} catch (AWTException e) {
			// TODO Auto-generated catch block
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
	}
	public static int getSymbolKeycode(char c){
		switch (c) {
		case '`': return 192;
		case '~': return FUCKJAVA
		case '.': return 46;
		default: return 65;
		}
	}
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		quick("I am a robot.");
	}

}

Same thing in C:

void SendKeys(char *keys)
{
        int i;
        for(i = 0; i < strlen(keys); i++)
        {
                keybd_event(VkKeyScan(keys[i]), MapVirtualKey(VkKeyScan(keys[i]), 0), 0, 0);
                keybd_event(VkKeyScan(keys[i]), MapVirtualKey(VkKeyScan(keys[i]), 0), KEYEVENTF_KEYUP, 0);
        }
}

Also see: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,466234.0.html

Read full topic
